com.camerontec.util.logger

Interface ILoggerFactory

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HighPerformanceLoggerFactory, Slf4jLoggerFactory

    public interface ILoggerFactory
    Factory of ILoggers.

    There is one factory implementation for each concrete ILogger type.

    Implementations should track all the ILogger instances they create and only create one instance for each unique logger name.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ILogger getLogger(Class<?> className)
      Return a named logger, creating one if required.
      ILogger getLogger(String loggerName)
      Return a named logger, creating one if required.
      ILoggerContext getLoggerContext()
      Return the logger context associated with the calling thread.
      Collection<ILogger> getLoggers()
      Return an unmodifiable collection of all loggers created via this factory.
      void start()
      Start the logger factory.
      void stop()
      Stop the logger factory.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
        Start the logger factory.

        This is an optional operation and need only be implemented when it makes sense.

      • stop

        void stop()
   throws InterruptedException
        Stop the logger factory.

        This is an optional operation and need only be implemented when it makes sense.

        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If interrupted while waiting for the logger factory to stop.

      • getLogger

        ILogger getLogger(String loggerName)
        Return a named logger, creating one if required.
        Parameters:
        loggerName - The logger name.
        Returns:
        A named logger. If it doesn't already exist it will be created.

      • getLogger

        ILogger getLogger(Class<?> className)
        Return a named logger, creating one if required.
        Parameters:
        className - The class name on which to base the logger name.
        Returns:
        A named logger based on class name. If it doesn't already exist it will be created.

      • getLoggers

        Collection<ILogger> getLoggers()
        Return an unmodifiable collection of all loggers created via this factory.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable collection of all loggers created via this factory.

      • getLoggerContext

        ILoggerContext getLoggerContext()
        Return the logger context associated with the calling thread.
        Returns:
        The logger context associated with the calling thread.
